doc.field: K.O. Friedrichs Collection on Richard Courant
K.O. Friedrichs Collection on Richard Courant

K.O. (Kurt Otto) Friedrichs was a German American mathematician who co-founded the Courant Institute of Mathematical Sciences at New York University. The K.O. Friedrichs Collection on Richard Courant (dated 1920-1980) consists of materials collected by Friedrichs documenting the life and career of Richard Courant. Materials include correspondence, speeches given in Courant's honor (including his memorial), reprints of conference proceedings and articles written by Courant (many in German), publications by other mathematicians, and summaries of visits to Germany.

Materials include correspondence, speeches given in Courant's honor (including his memorial), reprints of conference proceedings and articles written by Courant (many in German), publications by other mathematicians, and summaries of visits to Germany.

The K.O. Friedrichs Collection on Richard Courant (dated 1920-1980) consists of materials collected by Friedrichs documenting the life and career of Richard Courant. Materials include correspondence, speeches given in Courant's honor (including his memorial), reprints of conference proceedings and articles written by Courant (many in German), publications by other mathematicians, and summaries of visits to Germany.
K.O. (Kurt Otto) Friedrichs was a German American mathematician who co-founded the Courant Institute of Mathematical Sciences at New York University.

This collection was treated as an administrative transfer to the New York University Archives from the Courant Institute in the summer of 2023 when the Courant Institute Library closed. The accession number associated with this transfer is 2023.044.
Given to the Courant Institute Library by Martin Friedrichs, year unknown.
